column1: The most common cause of too much growth hormone release is a noncancerous (benign) tumor of the pituitary gland.
The doctor will perform a physical exam and ask about the child's symptoms.

Laboratory tests that may be ordered include: - Cortisol - Estradiol (girls) - Growth hormone suppression test - Prolactin - Increased growth factor-I - Testosterone (boys) - Thyroid hormone Imaging tests, such as CT or MRI scan of the head, also may be ordered to check for a pituitary tumor.
